column1: #Text=Are you — do they still teach at Bahia on Sunday ?
#Text=In fact I would have gone today , if it was n't for my back .
#Text=Well I finally found some people there I can dance with .
#Text=Besides , you , I mean if you 're a guy , if —
#Text=If you 're a woman , I mean , those guys 'll be all over you .
#Text=Do n't say that , Harold 's in the room .
#Text=Well I do n't necessarily mean , in a bad way , even though I 'm sure there are a few there , I 'm not dancing with guys .
#Text=All I can say is , the women are n't all over me .
#Text=But , but I remember , like I went there with this person , it 's kind of funny .
#Text=Th- this person did not want to dance .
#Text=So , every once in a while I 'd get up and dance , and it 's like , when I 'd come back , I mean there was some guy there , sitting in my chair .
#Text=I 'm thinking , God these guys do n't waste any time .
#Text=I mean , you turn your back and there 's somebody moving in .
#Text=I mean I do n't know if they —
#Text=Maybe Harold you should come with me .
#Text=So I can find — find some girls with empty chairs next to em ?
#Text=Well I do n't know if I told you , told you that story about that woman , who uh , went after that guy there ?
#Text=I was there Sunday three four weeks ago ?
#Text=Uh , after the class is over w- over with , I 'm sitting down at a table , there 's a woman from — who was in the class , and two men , sitting to my right , is a table with two women there .
#Text=They had apparently just come from Oba Oba .
#Text=And like , well they were attractive women , the one had on a real real short skirt .
#Text=Anyway , there was this guy in his fifties , out there dancing , by himself .

#Text=And the woman was just looking at him , making eyes , then she went out there , got on her knees , in front of him , in this skirt that 's this short , takes her hands , and goes along his toes , and then up , and is just doing like that .
#Text=I figured , oh , they must know each other .
#Text=And , they did that for the whole dance , and I mean , she was d- all kind of suggestive stuff , and touching him and everything , people would like cheering , and clapping , " go for it " .
#Text=The – the song ended , the guy set down , at another table .
#Text=At the table with her woman friend .
#Text=They never danced again the rest of the evening .
#Text=This is like — so I was thinking , this woman 's sitting about as far away from me as Jamie is .
#Text=And I was thinking , hm , this is interesting .
#Text=I wonder how long it was gon na take the guys in this club to move in on her .
#Text=No sooner did I think this thought , guys were over there .
#Text=What , you did n't ask her to dance ?
#Text=Well I was still trying to figure out , surely they must know each other , I mean , why was n't he sitting at her table ?
#Text=You mean , you were still thinking about it .
#Text=Anyway , this guy , I mean he comes over there , immediately afterwards —
#Text=The same guy who got his — the same guy who 's —
#Text=No , a random guy , who was like sitting about where you are .
#Text=He was sitting there , there were two guys sitting at a table right where you are .
#Text=And then these two women are sitting here .
#Text=So uh , he comes over there , and is talking with that woman I do n't know about what , but then like ten minutes later , she and her friend are over at their table .
#Text=And then , twenty minutes later , they were kinda like all over each other .
#Text=You know , kissing , et cetera , et cetera .
#Text=And I was thinking , it looks like these people are n't going home alone tonight .
#Text=Well , maybe I should n't go there then .
#Text=While discussing plans to go to a dance class in Bahia to learn lambada dancing , Miles tells his friends about an attractive woman he had seen dancing lewdly with a man there .
